intro: Bakerantha, commonly known as the "buttercup flower," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white petals. The plants typically grow in moist, temperate regions and are often found in meadows and wetlands. Bakerantha species are known for their ability to thrive in partial shade to full sun conditions. They are also valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
